p: All DF cases were determined according to the unified diagnostic criteria, Diagnostic Criteria for Dengue Fever (WS216-2008) [ 13], issued by the Chinese Ministry of Health, and reported to the online Notifiable Infectious Disease Report System (NIDRS). According to these criteria, DF can be determined clinically or by laboratory analyses. The suspected DF cases were identified by local experienced physicians, according to the clinical manifestations and epidemiological exposure history, and further clinical diagnoses were provided. The patients that were clinically diagnosed with DF and presented with a fourfold increase in specific IgG antibody titre, positive PCR test, or a positive virus isolation and identification test, were considered laboratory-confirmed patients.
